result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:36 AM This case is being called for a hearing. Defendant Kenneth J Hewitt in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Kenneth J Hewitt. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Atty Nolan provides the court with an update. She is requesting more time to consult with an expert; no objection by the State. Court will adjourn for further proceedings in approximately 60 days.
Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Nolan requesting the court unseal the documents related to her discovery request.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/1/22 - Court will authorize release of the records to Atty. Nolan if State does not object to unsealing the records then unseal.**
Amended Cash Bond Conditions signed by defendant on 8-26-22
Hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED 08/26/2022: Defendant is allowed to possess a cell phone and access the internet for the limited purposes of preparation of legal defense, work, handling his finances, and contacting his attorney and counseling purposes.  Defendant is not to possess any devices that access the internet, except for the cell phone.  

PREVIOUSLY ORDERED CONDITIONS: Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor.  Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet.  Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content.  Defendant to surrender their passport and pilot's license to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card and pilot's license during the pendency of this action.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant is allowed to possess a cell phone and the internet Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

1:38 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kenneth J Hewitt in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Kenneth J Hewitt.  Court notes a motion to modify bond has been filed and inquires if parties are prepared to proceed on the motion today.  Defense and State are prepared to proceed on the motion.  Atty. Nolan presents statements and is asking the court to modify to a lower cash bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Nolan presents additional arguments.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; bail will remain as previously set.

Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Nolan provides an update, she filed a supplemental discovery request and needs time to hear back from the State.  Atty. Nolan is also seeking some clarification with respect to the current conditions of bail. Court believes the bond conditions are clear as set and inquires if counsel is seeking to have the conditions modified.  Atty. Nolan confirms she is asking to have the conditions modified to allow use of the cell phone to visit religious sites and for legal research.  Atty. Woller presents statements and take no position with respect to the request to modify the bail conditions.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant the request and order conditions be amended to read: Defendant is allowed to possess a cell phone and access the internet for the limited purposes of work, preparation of legal defenses, handling his finances, contacting his attorney and counseling purposes; all other conditions remain as previously set.  Court denies the request to be allowed to use the cell phone to access Religious sites.  Atty. Nolan is requesting another further proceedings date in 60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Nolan.
Filed by Atty. Nolan.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:35 AM Defendant Kenneth J Hewitt in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Defense's Motion to Change Surety for Bail/Bond.
Attorney Nolan presents statements and states there is a stipulation on file to make the Defendant the full surety for the cash bail.
The State takes no position.
The Court grants the stipulation and signs the proposed order.
To Amend Bond Surety, signed by CC Rieck on 07/27/2022.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:31 AM Defendant Kenneth J Hewitt in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of 2nd amended complaint and waives reading of 2nd amended complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:14 PM Defendant Kenneth J Hewitt appeared by Zoom from a facility with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court takes a short recess at 1:30 PM to allow for the defendant and Attorney Van Severen to speak in a breakout room.  Matter recalled at 1:44 PM with the same appearances.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
